comment.author: 72791995@N00
comment._content: The "Double Fairly" type of locomotive was quite rare. However, one or two operate on the Ffestiniog railway in Wales.  I am not aware of any other reserved engines of this type.

comment.author: 41373397@N07
comment._content: There were some Fairlies in Mexico, also.  Don't know if any were saved.

comment.author: 38000216@N03
comment._content: Getting trains strong enough to haul goods up the Range to Toowoomba must have been challenging. My great grandfather, Robert Bailey, helped build the railway line. My grandfather, Joseph Featherstone, worked at Toowoomba Railway Station for many years. He was a railway ambulance man, and lead many competitions in south east Queensland. He was presented with the Thallon medal for his railway ambulance work, by the acting Governor of Queensland, in 1914.

comment.author: 41373397@N07
comment._content: Never heard of a "railway ambulance man."  Please explain.
